text: Taos is a real hit-or-miss kind of place
but if you know where to go there are
some real hidden gems I want to you
while downtown Taos has its charm we
found the most unique experiences are
outside of town and off the beaten path
starting with a Rio Grande del Norte
National Monument this brand spankin new
monuments more than just a campground
it's almost two hundred and fifty
thousand acres of public lands to
explore when I say spankin new I mean it
because it was just March 2013 that
President Obama proclaimed this area is
a National Monument
when it comes to exploring the area the
key is to look beyond the borders of
downtown not much beats a good view
tasty microbrews and a not so typical
pub menu this brewery is true to the
eco-minded quirky and eclectic vibe
we've come to expect from this area with
a contemporary twist if there's one
thing we're always searching for it it's
a smooth high-gravity brew and this
place gets our stamp of approval just
pass the brewery and down a long dirt
road is a special place where the locals
go to let it all hang out hope the
waters warm oh my gosh a quick drop down
an old stagecoach road leads to mamby
hot springs the springs get their name
from the con man arthur rush ford man be
who in the 1900s walled off the pools
and plan to make a fortune
he claimed the water could cure
nervousness rheumatism and intestinal
troubles after years of scheming man B
lost his land and was found dead in his
home
sad for mamby but good for us these
poles are free for everyone to enjoy
most and nothing but their birthday suit
now this is definitely a gym it's cold
hike up is not near as much fun bellies
for not cold
as if the springs weren't relaxing
enough our next gem takes it to another
level beatbox is a Spanish term meaning
high altitude refuge and that's exactly
what we found from the all new Mexican
wine which is surprisingly good to the
decadent house-made chocolates and
cheese that is good it's hard to believe
we're in the middle of nowhere New
Mexico to further our spoils we've saved
our favorite gem for last in a corporate
world of schedules and formalities world
renowned chef Chris mehar and bites us
into his home for what has to be one of
the most intimate cooking classes anyone
could experience this isn't reserved for
the well-to-do it's open to anyone even
us you know basically what we do here is
we approach cooking his art and baking
the signs so today it's about fun and
relaxation and doing art
do we mention he's a movie star from
filming with George Clooney and Jennifer
Lopez to cooking for the Dalai Lama and
President Clinton where else could we
still casually rub shoulders and dine
with a James Beard recognize celebrity
but don't be starstruck from the moment
we walked in we were treated just like
family so our hidden gems may not be
that hidden but their distinctly towels
and definitely not to be missed
hopefully we'll do it again soon either
here or wherever you live thank you very
much yeah sure yes your lips why are we
the only ones who cook us I don't know
